ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To serve as a centralized, customizable dashboard within the terminal for developers and tech users to monitor key information and statistics.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Terminal-based personal information dashboard â€¢ At-a-glance access to stats and data â€¢ Customizable modules â€¢ TUI/CUI interface â€¢ Free and open-source
ðŸ“– Summary: WTF (wtfutil) is a terminal-based personal information dashboard designed to provide developers and tech professionals with at-a-glance access to important but infrequently needed stats and data. It offers a customizable TUI/CUI experience for monitoring various aspects of your digital life and workflow directly from your command line.

ðŸš€ InnerTune | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a feature-rich, ad-free, and customizable music listening experience for YouTube Music on Android devices, leveraging Material 3 design principles.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Ad-free playback from YouTube/YouTube Music â€¢ Background playback â€¢ Search functionality for YouTube Music content â€¢ Login support â€¢ Offline playback (cache and download)
ðŸ“– Summary: InnerTune is an Android application that provides a Material 3-themed client for YouTube Music. It allows users to play music from YouTube Music without ads, with background playback, offline downloads, synchronized lyrics, and various audio customization options.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ my-blog | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To serve as a customizable and visually appealing personal blog platform with modern web technologies.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Beautiful UI with Emerald/Teal Theme â€¢ Light/Dark Mode â€¢ Fully Responsive â€¢ Smooth Animations â€¢ Markdown/MDX Support
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a modern, responsive, and customizable blog platform built with Next.js 14 and TypeScript. It features a beautiful UI with light/dark mode, smooth animations, Markdown/MDX support, and a tag system, designed for easy content creation and deployment.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ samarium | Blade
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide small businesses with an integrated, self-hostable, and cost-effective solution for managing core operations like sales, finances, and customer relations.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Simple invoice generation â€¢ Basic financial tracking â€¢ Customer database management â€¢ Basic inventory tracking â€¢ Simple checkout process
ðŸ“– Summary: Samarium is an open-source, Laravel-based business management system designed for small businesses. It offers integrated ERP, Point of Sale (POS), invoicing, customer management, and basic CMS features, all deployable via Docker.
